text:
Just want to confirm, with A/B testing in website pages, can you only create one variable per page at a time?

I was hoping to run multiple individual experiments on the same page.

from a purely scientific point of view - running multiple experiments on the same page would result in bad data, resulting in bad decision making.  So if it only allows having the whole page change to certain states instead of individual modules, that makes sense from a scientific point of view. having say 2 modules on a page run separate experiments would cause the experiments to theoretically affect eachother changing the results of the experiment in ways that would make the data useless.
I agree, although I was only going to test one variable per experiment to keep my data clean.  i.e. change CTAs in one, change Hero message in another
So I would end up simultaneously running multiple experiments with the same control.  Seems scientifically sound to me as long as only one variable is tested per experiment
yea I would think that should theoretically work then
oh well... theory means nothing when I can only actually create one variant.  Back to the drawing board I guess
:disappointed:
Last night around 8:40PM (CST) through Midnight (CST) one of our HS sites was occasionally getting cloudflare errors of the site timing out. Did anyone else have issues around this time with sites?
Our office was getting some really bad lag in the backend around 5:30PM EST but I haven’t heard a peep from any clients.
Can you DM me the site? I can check the logs
Normal support # and then ext 5
Is it possible to put no follow tags on blog author/topic pages?? If so, how? I know how to do it for an individual blog post but not for the dynamically rendered pages.
and for clarification is this supposed to be for partners exclusively or developers or?
You mean the social buttons at the top of the post?
or are you talking about no_index’ing those pages?
I think you’re correct reading it again I think he means the no_follow no_index

you can use a few conditions:
`is_blog_listing`
`blog_author`
and
`topic`
(I said by memory so maybe those are not exactly the vars)
Yeah sorry for the confusion. The client doesn't want them indexed by Google.

I think you can use as Gonzalo suggested, the `is_blog_listing` in the head of the template and conditionally add the meta robots no follow no index

I wanna say you can also do `is_blog_author` but you may just need to check if `blog_author` has a value

Hey all, has anyone done any work integrating Bullhorn CRM and HubSpot (besides contacts)? We had some required functionality added in the middle of a migration and we have been trying and failing to come up with other solutions that do what they need done.
So... just found out this is a thing: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/email/create-a-new-email-with-the-drag-and-drop-email-editor>
yea I saw that the other day
was like — well kills my idea to create the template to end all email templates
Is there a place to see all the in beta products or items that are being worked on? I feel like the actual beta site for HS that lists stuff, isn't actually up to date
That's a part of the new Marketing Hub Starter launched today.

As far as a single beta page, I believe the Partner Marketing team is working on a resource but I can check with them. We generally list betas on the Product Updates blog as well: <http://HubSpot.com/product-updates|HubSpot.com/product-updates>.
Could we create a channel called "In Beta" and then whenever a new beta is launched or in the works we could perhaps help with feedback/testing
We're working on releasing a CMS changelog... that would include all updates, big and small, and would include betas.

I like this idea  ... we would likely create something called "Changelog" which notifies all changes including betas. 
Then have separate channels for individual betas, like the <#C960Q64G4|design-manager> channel
will likely be going around INBOUND time

you are correct that the local hubl server uses the “all in one” json format of the modules that you get from the modules API. The format you see in FTP is just broken out a bit so it’s easier to edit. But I agree it would be nice to support both formats
Have I heard somewhere that HubSpot is supporting Font Awesome 5?  asking for a friend... <https://fontawesome.com/icons/joint?style=solid>

lol @ Joint, surprised thats in there.

Yes they do support Font Awsome 5 in their new icon field for custom modules.
Personally I haven’t used it yet, but it appears that people have been having trouble with getting it to load the scripts or the documentation isn’t clear about doing that.
Apparently it's a sponsored icon
What a weird world it is in 2018
hahhaa
strong offering.  1,000 contacts is $50.  15,000 contacts not bad either at $280.  Going mainstream.  Nice.  Smart moves.

I created a new custom master template, then i applied that template to a web site page.

I am not sure why I am not seeing the “+” icon to add modules while I am editing the page
<@UBRG1R3EW> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/UBRG1R3EW/FBRM11JAV/image.png|image.png>
Thanks, Joe!
click edit modules(the cube) then screesnshot what you see in that pane and post it here. I’m thinking the template may not have a flex column
Do you have a flexible column in the template? thats the only way you'd be able to make use of that + sign to add modules.
that did it :slightly_smiling_face: thanks
Anyone know off hand if in DM2 `{%include "fileurl" %}` is supposed to work at all anymore?
I might have unintentionally upgraded a site that’s going to be a pain in the butt to upgrade.
it does not in v2 modules. See Restricted HubL in <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/reference>
I’m aware of modules, sorry should have been more specific, I was meaning in CSS files
oh that still works

good, just trying to understand something weird going on with a client website (there’s atleast 1 module where the background of the module went white, with white text making it illegible and no one edited the page, thought maybe something went screwy in transitioning to DM2)
